summary: Joseph H. Kearney Jr. is mentioned in documents related to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) investigation into the assassinations of Martin Luther King Jr. and John F. Kennedy. The documents consist of communications between the FBI, its field offices, and the HSCA. These communications include requests for files, informant information, and agent details. The specific role or significance of Joseph H. Kearney Jr. within these investigations is not explicitly detailed in the provided summaries, but his name appears in the context of FBI responses to HSCA requests for information.
significance: The significance of Joseph H. Kearney Jr. in the JFK context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. His name appears in the context of FBI communications with the HSCA during its investigation into the assassinations of Martin Luther King Jr. and John F. Kennedy.
